properties.abstract: This tour across the steepest summits on the shores of Lac de la Gruyère starts at Broc-Fabrique, where chocolate and electric power are produced. And it ends at Charmey, where cheese is made. Moreover, Charmey has a spa, where muscles, sore from the steep descents from Vanil des Cours and Mont des Chevalets, can be treated. Afterwards you may hike back to Broc-Fabrique in 1½ h along Lac des Montsalvens and through the Gorges de la Jogne.
properties.subtitle: Bon appétit!
properties.title: Broc-Fabrique – Vanil des Cours – Charmey

sac_photos.title: Vanil des Cours – Mont des Chevalets
Mont Bifé: always on the edge
The summit cross on Vanil des Cours
On the descent from Vanil des Cours, view to La Berra
Bains de la Gruyère against the backdrop of Vanil des Cours and Mont des Chevalets
Lac de Montsalvens, view to Dents Verts

segments.description: From Broc-Fabrique cross the La Jogne eastward, turn right to pass under a bridge and go up towards the road. Before reaching it, branch off to the right. The hiking trail crosses the road three times. It leads to Châtel-sur-Montsalvens passing below the ruins of Château de Montsalvens. From P. 876 at the locality “La Larisse” turn left towards Botterens and follow the trail until a path branches off to the right, which leads to Vanil des Cours. Follow this path on the ridge, sometimes through the forest, sometimes along the forest edge. At times, it is a large trail. After a short descent from a knoll (ca.1310 m) ascend steeply to Mont Rounes (P. 1342, unnamed on the map).
segments.title: Broc-Fabrique – Mont Rounes

segments.description: Descend to a grassy saddle (ca. 1280 m), ascend to a nameless knoll (P. 1393), and descend again to a saddle (ca. 1380 m), from where you reach the rocky Mont Bifé summit (1482 m; some scrambling is required). Follow the east ridge for a short while, then descend northward to reach a bifurcation (ca. 1430 m). On the south-west ridge ascend to Vanil des Cours (1562 m) with a summit cross.
segments.title: Mont Rounes – Mont Bifé – Vanil des Cours

segments.description: Follow the flat south-east ridge, then descend steeply on the north side (rocky, precarious when wet). At the bifurcation at ca. 1410 m turn right to reach a saddle (ca. 1404 m). Following a faint path, ascend to Mont des Chevalets (P. 1450, unnamed on the map). The highest point is in a sparse forest. A few steps further east from the summit cross there is a pretty view to the Javro valley. Descend on the south-east ridge until the Les Chevalets chalet (1222 m) and continue on trails via Pra Aubert to reach the road to Cerniat (926 m). On the road hike to Cerniat. North of the church the hiking trail to Charmey begins. It descends to the Javro gorge (pedestrian bridge at ca. 820 m) and leads up to the “Le Pra” locality. That is where the Bains de la Gruyère await tired hikers (open daily all year).
segments.title: Vanil des Cours – Mont des Chevalets – Charmey

segments.description: Leaving out Mont des Chevalets: from Vanil des Cours go back following the south-west ridge. Then descend to Cerniat on the hiking trail. From P. 1068 you can descend directly to the church along the forest edge.
segments.title: Variant 1: descent on hiking trails (leaving out Mont des Chevalets)

segments.description: From Vanil des Cours descend northward to La Guille (1269 m) and past the La Chia knoll (ca. 1360 m) to reach a col (P. 1334). The hiking trail to La Berra goes north-eastward via Le Solitou (1381 m) to reach another col (1376 m). Now leave the hiking trail to take a path on the ridge. Follow this path, at first in the forest, then along the forest edge to reach Mont aux Oies (P. 1474, unnamed on the map). In the pasture descend south-eastward to reach the hiking trail, which you meet, where it disappears in the forest. It descends to a saddle (ca. 1430 m), traverses a knoll (P. 1456) and finally ends at Gîte d’Allières (1485 m) close to La Berra; T1-T2, Vanil des Cours – Gîte d'Allières ca. 2 h.
segments.title: Variant 2: from Vanil des Cours to Gîte d’Allières (accommodation)
